description:
Fate and reincarnation deliver brilliant military strategist, Kongming, from warring, ancient China to Japan’s modern party hot spot in Shibuya City, Tokyo. After a lifetime of battles and military skirmishes, Kongming wished with his last breath to be reborn in a world of peace and prosperity. It’s nearly two millennia later and he’s finding his way in a very different world than that of his past life. When he meets Eiko, an amateur musician with big dreams, the unlikely duo strikes up an even unlikelier friendship. Eiko has street smarts to help Kongming navigate this strange new world, and Kongming will use his strategic mind to help Eiko achieve stardom!

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

An advanced online screening of the first episode was held on March 31, 2022, but the weekly TV release began on April 5, 2022.
synonyms: ขงเบ้งเจาะเวลามาปั้นดาว

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Band
tags.description: Main cast is a group of musicians.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Anachronism
tags.description: Prominently features elements that are out of place in the historical period the work takes place in, particularly modern elements in a historical setting.

tags.name: Hip-hop Music
tags.description: Centers on the musical style of hip-hop, not to be applied to anime that use hip-hop in its soundtrack.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Bar
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a bar.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Ancient China
tags.description: Setting in ancient china, does not apply to fantasy settings.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Rock Music
tags.description: Centers on the musical style of rock, not to be applied to anime that use rock in its soundtrack.

tags.name: Dancing
tags.description: Centers around the art of dance.

tags.name: Classic Literature
tags.description: Discusses or adapts a work of classic world literature.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/関口可奈味)

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/), currently affilaited with [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/東潤一)

Founder and representative director of Studio Easter.
**Iida Satoki** is a Japanese freelance sound director.

[Website](http://djgenki.net/) | [Profile (Hifumi Inc)](https://hifumi-inc.co.jp/team/hikota-genki/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/genkianamei) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/DJGenki_JP) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/racerxkakipidaisuki) | [Soundcloud](https://soundcloud.com/genkianamei)

Genki Hikota, better known as DJ Genki is a Japanese composer, arranger and DJ.

[Website](https://96neko.jp/) | [Twitter (Main)](https://twitter.com/96__neko) | [Twitter (Sub)](https://twitter.com/96_neko_sub) | [YouTube 1](https://www.youtube.com/user/96nekoch) | [YouTube 2](https://www.youtube.com/c/SUB-96NEKOCHANNEL) | [Nico Nico Douga](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/9217369/mylist/15614906) | [Bilibili](https://space.bilibili.com/392617988) | [OPENREC](https://www.openrec.tv/user/96nyan)

__Introduction:__
96Neko, pronounced as Kuroneko, is an utaite and has been active in the vocaloid scene since 2009. She has covered over 200 songs in addition to performing, writing, composing and producing a large amount of original songs of her own.

She is well-known for her husky, low range vocals and for being a "ryouseirui", a term used to describe vocalists who are able to sing in both typical male and female vocal ranges. However, she is also able to sing in a very cute female voice, which can be heard in her cover of [Soratobazu](https://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm19159618).

96Neko is also a Virtual YouTuber and posts her activities on her sub-channel. On October 5, 2019, she had announced her new VTuber persona by the name of Kuroki Natsume. As of July 9, 2021, she settled to merge the personas, expressing that she finds it limiting (and other factors) and decided to perform all her activities under her utaite name. However, she stated that people may still call her VTuber persona by whatever name they want, whether it be Kuroki Natsume or Kuroneko, and asked them to not worry.

__Biography:__
During her early utaite career on Nico Nico Douga, she would often do duets with the vocaloids [Kagamine Rin](https://anilist.co/staff/191794/Rin-Kagamine) and [Kagamine Len](https://anilist.co/staff/154290/Len-Kagamine). She also sung many parody songs, where she mostly dueted with Kagamine Len or [vipTenchou](https://twitter.com/viptentyo). In later years, she would start collaborating with the utaite [Amatsuki](https://anilist.co/staff/131102/Amatsuki) in duets.

96Neko requested that people shouldn't record her anonymously with the intention of redistributing the footage commercially. She is fine with people recording for personal entertainment usage, however.

Her album, Iris, which was released just three days before her twentieth birthday, was her way of thanking her fans and supporters prior to her turning twenty. It also served as a final installment to her teenage years as an utaite.

A new all female vocal unit conformed by vocalists of different music groups:

-hibiki and moka from the music group and dance unit [lol](https://anilist.co/staff/129425/lol).
-Akina and Taki from the female dance vocal group [FAKY](https://anilist.co/staff/132978/FAKY).
-Maria Kaneya from the dance vocal group [GENIC](https://anilist.co/staff/210813/GENIC).

[Website](https://96neko.jp/) | [Twitter (Main)](https://twitter.com/96__neko) | [Twitter (Sub)](https://twitter.com/96_neko_sub) | [YouTube 1](https://www.youtube.com/user/96nekoch) | [YouTube 2](https://www.youtube.com/c/SUB-96NEKOCHANNEL) | [Nico Nico Douga](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/9217369/mylist/15614906) | [Bilibili](https://space.bilibili.com/392617988) | [OPENREC](https://www.openrec.tv/user/96nyan)

As of July 9, 2021, she settled to merge the personas, expressing that she finds it limiting (and other factors) and decided to perform all her activities under her utaite name. However, she stated that people may still call her VTuber persona by whatever name they want, whether it be Kuroki Natsume or Kuroneko, and asked them to not worry.

__[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/nocty-x-rucca/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mizoguchi_rucca)__

__Birthplace:__ Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan

__Introduction:__
Takanori Mizoguchi, alternatively known by stage name RUCCA, is a Japanese lyricist and novelist. 

__Trivia:__
- He uses the name Mizoguchi Takanori (溝口貴紀) mainly when providing material to artists and idols.
- The name RUCCA is mainly used when providing material to the animation and games industry, but was also used once during a special occasion.
- The name L(R)UCCA) used mainly in context, or relation to record label _pure: infinity_, where he provides material for four-piece rock band 100% FREE
- The last name 溝口RUCCA is used as his pen-name when writing novels.

(Source: [Wikipedia (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%BA%9D%E5%8F%A3%E8%B2%B4%E7%B4%80), edited)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/chikichikiko) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/chikichikiko/) | [Blog](https://okiayuryotaro.jugem.jp/)

Married to [Ai Maeda](https://anilist.co/staff/95487). Previously married to [Nao Nagasawa](https://anilist.co/staff/96037) with whom he has a daughter.

__Height: __168 cm 
__Agency:__ Holy Peak

[Website](https://sp.kobayashiyu.com/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/yu-no-jiyu-cho/) | [Profile (Holy Peak)](https://holypeak.com/talent/voice-actor-women/yukobayashi/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/holy_kobayashi)

A Japanese voice actress, singer, and former model.

__Non-anime roles:__
- Aria - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
